</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Election: </strong></span><span>The Washington Post obtained the </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/trump-raffensperger-call-georgia-vote/2021/01/03/d45acb92-4dc4-11eb-bda4-615aaefd0555_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">audio recording</a></span><span> of an hour-long call in which President Trump repeatedly tried to pressure Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger, a Republican, into finding enough votes that would make him the winner in the state. Raffensperger rebuffed Trump, saying “the data you have is wrong.”</span>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/03/stocks-set-records-2020-despite-pandemic-economic-crisis?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Stocks in 2020
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="This is fine meme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTkzL3RoaXNfaXNfZmluZV9tZW1lLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Popular meme</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">During a year of human suffering, economic crisis, and psychological trauma, stocks in the S&P 500 index rose 16% to close 2020 at a record high. The tech-heavy Nasdaq gained a remarkable 44%. And the Dow will also begin trading this morning at a record.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So why the split screen? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">A flood of stimulus money: </strong></span><span>The Fed lowered the cost of borrowing money to nearly zero and Congress poured trillions into the economy to support ailing households and businesses.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Corporations seized on the New Normal: </strong></span><span>Big tech giants, e-commerce leaders like Etsy and Shopify, and biotechs like Moderna all benefited financially from the pandemic.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The rise of retail traders: </strong></span><span>With nothing else to spend money on, well-to-do individual investors went hyperactive on free trading apps like Robinhood. In June, individual investors accounted for about 20% of stock market activity on average, per Citadel Securities.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It wasn’t just stocks. Gold (+24.6%) and silver (+47.6%) had their best years since 2010. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And it wasn’t just physical assets hitting stratospheric levels. Yesterday, the price of the cryptocurrency bitcoin sprinted past $34,000, extending its wild 2020 rally into the new year. Bitcoin gained more than 300% in 2020, and it’s already up over 12% in 2021. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The b-word</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If it looks like a bubble, smells like a bubble, and exhibits price-to-earning ratios like a bubble...is this thing going to implode soon? </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Signs the bubble is about to pop: </strong></span><span>The </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-02/dizzying-valuations-ipo-craze-tick-boxes-on-bubble-checklist?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rapid rise</a></span><span> in special purpose acquisition companies (SPACs) taking untested companies public, astronomical first-day “pops” when a company IPOs, and loads of speculative trading from retail investors, writes Bloomberg.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Signs the bubble is not a bubble, just healthy growth: </strong></span><span>the Fed’s promise to keep interest rates low for the foreseeable future and the arrival of coronavirus vaccines to end the pandemic. </span>
</li>
</ul>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PUBLIC HEALTH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/03/us-vaccine-rollout-starts-slow-fauci-sees-improvement?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
About That Pandemic
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Vaccine clock" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yOTIxL3ZhY2NpbmVfY2xvY2suanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We may have turned the page on 2020, but the coronavirus remains a public health and economic menace. The death toll in the U.S. <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-deaths-us-johns-hopkins-f98dd5d1659ff3a1d75413a980007473?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surpassed 350,000</a> and New York topped 1 million cases, the fourth state to hit the milestone. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">At least we have two vaccines to immunize people, right? </strong>Well, even that’s not going according to plan. The U.S. has fallen far short of its goal to administer 20 million doses by the end of 2020 (the CDC reports the number at 2.8 million). On Friday, GOP Sen. Mitt Romney <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/01/politics/romney-slams-vaccine-plan/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blasted</a> the process: “That comprehensive vaccination plans have not been developed at the federal level and sent to the states as models is as incomprehensible as it is inexcusable." </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Dr. Anthony Fauci, the nation’s top infectious disease official, acknowledged there were “glitches” in the process, but said the U.S. was picking up the pace over the weekend and should be on track soon.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Critics of the U.S.’ rollout point to <a href="https://www.axios.com/israel-leads-world-covid-19-vaccinations-million-3d020c3e-9876-417b-9853-84a9723f0e44.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Israel’s success</a>, where more than 10% of the population has been immunized.  </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GENERAL BIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/03/2021-brings-changes-healthcare-streaming?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
New Year, Who Dis?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="NEW YORK, NEW YORK - DECEMBER 31: Times Square sits empty while firework..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTk0LzIwMjFfdGltZXNfc3F1YXJlX25ld195ZWEuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Noam Galai/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A quick recap of some new rules/regulations/changes that went into effect while you weren’t watching the ball drop on New Year’s.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Minimum wage: </strong>Twenty states and 32 smaller localities <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/31/business/economy/minimum-wage-15-dollar-hour.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised their minimum wage</a>, 27 of those to $15/hour or more, on Jan. 1. President-elect Joe Biden is in favor of a $15 federal minimum wage; it currently stands at $7.25.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Stamford branch of streaming services:</strong> In case you’ve managed to avoid NBCUniversal’s ad blitz promoting the move, <em>The Office </em>has left Netflix for NBC’s streaming service, Peacock. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Transparency in Coverage: </strong>The Trump administration’s <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/01/02/952806795/the-new-year-will-bring-more-transparency-in-hospital-prices?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new rule</a> that forces hospitals to disclose the prices of their services went into effect. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Distracted driving: </strong>A few states are <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/laws-taking-effect-2021-marijuana-paid-leave-minimum-wage-152654291.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">clamping down</a> on the use of cellphones while driving. In Virginia, you can’t use a phone for any reason when behind the wheel. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Expiring copyrights: </strong>Classic works from the year 1925, including <em>The Great Gatsby</em>, have now entered the <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/01/01/951171599/party-like-its-1925-on-public-domain-day-gatsby-and-dalloway-are-in?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">public domain</a>. That means, among other things, you can make any <em>Gatsby </em>adaptation you’d like without asking for permission or paying a fee. How about a TikTok musical to get things started? </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/03/brexit-finally-happened-now?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Britain to the EU
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Larry David saying goodbye" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=378 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xUOxf9qX7c3uRKEGXe/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Larry David saying goodbye" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xUOxf9qX7c3uRKEGXe/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Four-and-a-half years after the infamous vote was held, the United Kingdom officially “Brexited” from the European Union on January 1. Now that the deed is done, let’s turn our attention to the <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-eu/with-little-ado-a-divided-united-kingdom-casts-off-into-the-brexit-unknown-idUSKBN2950CL?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ripples</a> created by Britain’s geopolitical cannonball. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Economically</strong></span><span>, the more than 1,200-page trade deal signed Dec. 30 will have the biggest impact. Britain is now out of the single-market economy that guaranteed EU members could buy and sell goods with each other without tariffs or quotas. The new trade deal offers many of the same freedoms, but lays out </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/brexit-europe-global-trade-england-english-channel-a51ff59b174931cd16858dd7021a007c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shiny new red tape</a></span><span> and additional regulatory barriers for goods passing across the EU-UK border.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Geopolitically</strong></span><span>, Brexiteers are excited to have “freedom in our hands,” said Prime Minister Boris Johnson. But opponents think leaving the bloc will torpedo Britain’s diplomatic standing on the global stage. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> The spirit of Brexit has seeped through the UK itself; Scotland and Northern Ireland, which voted strongly against Brexit, could <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/31/world/europe/brexit-eu-advantages.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">opt to leave</a> the United Kingdom to try and rejoin the EU. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Optional homework: </strong>One of Morning Brew’s most popular links of all time is <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rNu8XDBSn10&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this explanation</a> of the difference between the UK, Great Britain, and England.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/03/week-ahead?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

The Week Ahead

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Politics: </strong>Georgia will be on everyone’s minds tomorrow when two tight, intense runoff races will decide the party that controls the Senate and the ability of Joe Biden to enact his agenda. Get ready to wait—the results may take a few days. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>On Wednesday, Congress will meet to certify the Electoral College vote that declares Joe Biden the winner of the presidential election. Some GOP lawmakers, including Sen. Ted Cruz, are trying to </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/02/11-republican-senators-push-to-delay-certification-of-election-results.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">delay</a></span><span> the certification.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Earnings: </strong>Walgreens reports on Thursday, but other than that it’s a quiet week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Economic data: </strong>It may be 2021, but we’re still tallying the wreckage from 2020. The December jobs report on Friday will round out the full picture of the historically disastrous year for the labor market. In percentage terms, it was the worst employment recession since WWII. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Everything else:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Discovery’s streaming service, called (what else?) Discovery Plus, launches today. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The NFL playoffs start on Saturday.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The final Alex Trebek-hosted episodes of </span><span><em>Jeopardy! </em></span><span>will air this week.</span>
</li>
</ul>

Raffensperger rebuffed Trump, saying “the data you have is wrong.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMany stock markets around the world were closed on New Year’s Day, so today will be the first trading session of the year for most investors. They hope 2021 returns will be as lucrative as last year’s.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nMARKETS \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/03/stocks-set-records-2020-despite-pandemic-economic-crisis?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nStocks in 2020\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"This is fine meme\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNTkzL3RoaXNfaXNfZmluZV9tZW1lLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePopular meme\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDuring a year of human suffering, economic crisis, and psychological trauma, stocks in the S\u0026P 500 index rose 16% to close 2020 at a record high. The tech-heavy Nasdaq gained a remarkable 44%. And the Dow will also begin trading this morning at a record.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo why the split screen? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eA flood of stimulus money: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Fed lowered the cost of borrowing money to nearly zero and Congress poured trillions into the economy to support ailing households and businesses.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCorporations seized on the New Normal: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBig tech giants, e-commerce leaders like Etsy and Shopify, and biotechs like Moderna all benefited financially from the pandemic.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe rise of retail traders: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith nothing else to spend money on, well-to-do individual investors went hyperactive on free trading apps like Robinhood. In June, individual investors accounted for about 20% of stock market activity on average, per Citadel Securities.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt wasn’t just stocks. Gold (+24.6%) and silver (+47.6%) had their best years since 2010. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd it wasn’t just physical assets hitting stratospheric levels. Yesterday, the price of the cryptocurrency bitcoin sprinted past $34,000, extending its wild 2020 rally into the new year. Bitcoin gained more than 300% in 2020, and it’s already up over 12% in 2021. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe b-word\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf it looks like a bubble, smells like a bubble, and exhibits price-to-earning ratios like a bubble...is this thing going to implode soon? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSigns the bubble is about to pop: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-01-02/dizzying-valuations-ipo-craze-tick-boxes-on-bubble-checklist?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erapid rise\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in special purpose acquisition companies (SPACs) taking untested companies public, astronomical first-day “pops” when a company IPOs, and loads of speculative trading from retail investors, writes Bloomberg.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSigns the bubble is not a bubble, just healthy growth: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethe Fed’s promise to keep interest rates low for the foreseeable future and the arrival of coronavirus vaccines to end the pandemic. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe may have turned the page on 2020, but the coronavirus remains a public health and economic menace. The death toll in the U.S. \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-deaths-us-johns-hopkins-f98dd5d1659ff3a1d75413a980007473?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurpassed 350,000\u003c/a\u003e and New York topped 1 million cases, the fourth state to hit the milestone. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAt least we have two vaccines to immunize people, right? \u003c/strong\u003eWell, even that’s not going according to plan. The U.S. has fallen far short of its goal to administer 20 million doses by the end of 2020 (the CDC reports the number at 2.8 million). On Friday, GOP Sen. Mitt Romney \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/01/politics/romney-slams-vaccine-plan/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblasted\u003c/a\u003e the process: “That comprehensive vaccination plans have not been developed at the federal level and sent to the states as models is as incomprehensible as it is inexcusable.\" \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDr. Anthony Fauci, the nation’s top infectious disease official, acknowledged there were “glitches” in the process, but said the U.S. was picking up the pace over the weekend and should be on track soon.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCritics of the U.S.’ rollout point to \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/israel-leads-world-covid-19-vaccinations-million-3d020c3e-9876-417b-9853-84a9723f0e44.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eIsrael’s success\u003c/a\u003e, where more than 10% of the population has been immunized.  \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA quick recap of some new rules/regulations/changes that went into effect while you weren’t watching the ball drop on New Year’s.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMinimum wage: \u003c/strong\u003eTwenty states and 32 smaller localities \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/31/business/economy/minimum-wage-15-dollar-hour.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraised their minimum wage\u003c/a\u003e, 27 of those to $15/hour or more, on Jan. 1. President-elect Joe Biden is in favor of a $15 federal minimum wage; it currently stands at $7.25.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Stamford branch of streaming services:\u003c/strong\u003e In case you’ve managed to avoid NBCUniversal’s ad blitz promoting the move, \u003cem\u003eThe Office \u003c/em\u003ehas left Netflix for NBC’s streaming service, Peacock. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTransparency in Coverage: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Trump administration’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/01/02/952806795/the-new-year-will-bring-more-transparency-in-hospital-prices?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew rule\u003c/a\u003e that forces hospitals to disclose the prices of their services went into effect. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDistracted driving: \u003c/strong\u003eA few states are \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/laws-taking-effect-2021-marijuana-paid-leave-minimum-wage-152654291.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclamping down\u003c/a\u003e on the use of cellphones while driving. In Virginia, you can’t use a phone for any reason when behind the wheel. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eExpiring copyrights: \u003c/strong\u003eClassic works from the year 1925, including \u003cem\u003eThe Great Gatsby\u003c/em\u003e, have now entered the \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/2021/01/01/951171599/party-like-its-1925-on-public-domain-day-gatsby-and-dalloway-are-in?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epublic domain\u003c/a\u003e. That means, among other things, you can make any \u003cem\u003eGatsby \u003c/em\u003eadaptation you’d like without asking for permission or paying a fee. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFour-and-a-half years after the infamous vote was held, the United Kingdom officially “Brexited” from the European Union on January 1. Now that the deed is done, let’s turn our attention to the \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-britain-eu/with-little-ado-a-divided-united-kingdom-casts-off-into-the-brexit-unknown-idUSKBN2950CL?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eripples\u003c/a\u003e created by Britain’s geopolitical cannonball. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEconomically\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, the more than 1,200-page trade deal signed Dec. 30 will have the biggest impact. Britain is now out of the single-market economy that guaranteed EU members could buy and sell goods with each other without tariffs or quotas. The new trade deal offers many of the same freedoms, but lays out \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/brexit-europe-global-trade-england-english-channel-a51ff59b174931cd16858dd7021a007c?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshiny new red tape\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and additional regulatory barriers for goods passing across the EU-UK border.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGeopolitically\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, Brexiteers are excited to have “freedom in our hands,” said Prime Minister Boris Johnson. But opponents think leaving the bloc will torpedo Britain’s diplomatic standing on the global stage. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e The spirit of Brexit has seeped through the UK itself; Scotland and Northern Ireland, which voted strongly against Brexit, could \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/31/world/europe/brexit-eu-advantages.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eopt to leave\u003c/a\u003e the United Kingdom to try and rejoin the EU. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Optional homework: \u003c/strong\u003eOne of Morning Brew’s most
